poem:
Title: "In the Drift of Voting Winds"

Shuffling marks on ballots bind,
the fate of an ancient, vibrant land.
Four seats declared in the morning grind,
three to the wheel of a modulated hand.

One hopeful voice, a Congress strand,
struggles against the tides of time,
Await, fair India, understand,
Every tick of the clock is a sublime rhyme.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
